intro: Chirita horsfieldii var. scaberrima, commonly known as the rough-leaved chirita, is a species of flowering plant in the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
